Claudine Aoun explains why she was absent from the Baabda demonstration and thus responded to Bassil's accusation of "treason".
05 Nov 2019, 06:44 by Lebanon 24
The daughter of President Claudine Aoun Roukoz was absent from the demonstration organized by the Free Patriotic Movement in support of President Michel Aoun in the vicinity of Baabda Palace yesterday. Strong 'and boss. So where does the president's daughter stand from the popular movement and its demands? What is its approach to the current crisis? At first glance, Claudine Aoun appears to be in an awkward position, as the president is her father, Brigadier General Roukoz, her husband, and the head of her sister-in-law's current, leading to the assumption that she must turn the angles so that no one from the sides of this delicate political-family equation gets angry. However, when Aoun begins to explain her positions about what is happening, it turns out that she is clear and frank, she does not hide or disguise her convictions, but speak out "even if some will annoy me or betray me." She told Al-Jumhuriya that she was taking the plane back to Lebanon at the time of the “National Movement” demonstration in support of the President of the Republic. “But even if I was in Lebanon at the time, I was not personally participating in this demonstration,” she asked. Of course, I appreciate all the Aounis or those belonging to the “current” who participated in the Baabda demonstration to confirm that they stand with President Aoun, after nearly two weeks of enduring provocations. The harassment, of all kinds, from political accusations and banditry, but with regard to me personally, ka It is illogical to participate in such a move. " Aoun points out that from her position she is the head of the National Commission for Women's Affairs. It calls for the civil state, confronts corruption, or demands human rights. The authority should listen to it and address its causes. " Based on personal experience, she adds: "Did you know that my son, for example, had to emigrate because he had found a job abroad, while many others were waiting for a similar opportunity to emigrate as well?" In such circumstances, it is natural for some parties to try to ride the wave of popular protests to target the Covenant or Hizbullah, she said. What do you think of Minister Gebran Bassil's speech to the demonstrators in the vicinity of Baabda Palace? Claudine Aoun says, "I didn't hear it." Then she noted that she had seen on social media the speech of President Aoun, "It was inclusive, as his speech last Thursday." Commenting on Basil's assertion that there is no place in the current for fear or traitor? "Some friends sent me this passage because they thought it was probably directed at my husband, Brigadier Shamil Roukoz," she says. "Whatever the case, nobody gives Brigadier General Roukoz lessons in patriotism and loyalty. He did not collect this popular credit and was not elected a deputy thanks to anyone, but because of his national career, and therefore we do not consider that we are concerned with the charge of treason, "because I did not have anything to accuse us that we failed him." He is the one whose behavior is not as much as the aspirations of his people. " "Igo, as a daughter of the president, is ready to sit at home if the country's interest is necessary, because a total collapse will not relieve any party, and its actions will arrive," he said.
